intro: Erysimum erucastrum, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a raceme, blooming in early spring. Erysimum erucastrum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is sometimes used in rock gardens or as a wildflower in naturalized settings.
